title: Dynamic Containment assets jump into action following French interconnector trip
lead: Battery storage was called into action following ​the IFA2 interconnector with France – which went live late last month​ – tripping on Friday (29 January).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Smart meter rollout reaches 10 million milestone
lead: ​The 10 millionth smart meter has been installed in Great Britain in a significant milestone for the technology.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: British Gas Evolve and EDF selected as Suppliers of Last Resort
lead: ​British Gas Evolve has been appointed to take on Simplicity’s customers, while EDF takes on Green Network Energy’s, following the collapse of the two small suppliers last week.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem independent system operator call 'only the first step in a longer journey'
lead: ​Ofgem’s recommendation that an independent system operator is created is "understandable" but “only the first step on a longer journey”.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO opens consultation into disconnection of embedded generation
lead: National Grid ESO (NGESO) has opened a consultation to develop new guidelines around disconnection of embedded generation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: IONITY completes six new 350kW EV charger installs
lead: ​UK Power Networks (UKPN) has worked with IONITY for the installation of six high-power chargers at Extra Motorway Services’ area on the M25.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Two more suppliers close leaving over 400,000 customers to Ofgem's safety net
lead: Another two power suppliers have ceased to trade, in what continues to be a challenging market for smaller players.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ESB Energy latest to join Zap-Pay EV charging payment service
lead: ​Zap-Map has signed up a second electric vehicle (EV) chargepoint operator – ESB Energy – to its Zap-Pay service.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Renewables overtake fossil fuels in Europe but must triple to reach carbon neutrality by 2050
lead: ​Renewables have overtaken fossil fuels in Europe in what is being hailed as a “landmark” moment.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPN to develop electrified heating roadmap in Sussex trial
lead: ​UK Power Networks is to develop a roadmap for electrified heating through a trial in Sussex village Barcombe.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Engie to install 600 EV chargepoints at Premier Inn hotels
lead: ​Engie has secured a contract with Whitbread to install electric vehicle (EV) chargepoints at Premier Inn hotels.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid recommends over £183m in 2021 network reinforcement costs
lead: ​An investment of over £183 million is being recommended by National Grid ESO to support network reinforcement in 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: WPD targets £6bn investment in RIIO-ED2 draft plan
lead: ​Western Power Distribution (WPD) is going to invest £6 billion in its network in the run up to net zero by 2050.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem proposes £100,000 fine for Symbio Energy to send ‘strong message’ about RO payments
lead: ​Ofgem has proposed a £100,000 fine for Symbio Energy to send a “strong message” about late payments into government renewables schemes.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF’s Hinkley Point C delayed a further six months as costs continue to grow
lead: EDF’s Hinkley Point C nuclear plant will be delayed by a further six months due to disruption from COVID-19.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica to support ABB UK's EV ambitions with electrification package
lead: ​Centrica is to provide electric vehicle (EV) charging installations for ABB UK as the latter looks to electrify its fleet by 2025.
author: Alice Grundy

title: OVO unveils 'pioneering' type of use EV charging tariff
lead: ​OVO Energy has launched a ‘type of use’ tariff for electric vehicle (EV) charging that offers a flat rate of 6p/kWh at any time of day.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Social Energy to expand offering and target international growth following new investment
lead: Renewable energy supplier Social Energy has received a significant investment from fund manager CarVal Investor to grow its business and enter new markets.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Statkraft to optimise 68MW of Irish storage in RWE deal
lead: ​Statkraft is to provide market access and trading optimisation for battery storage assets being developed by RWE in Ireland.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SSEN rolls out new monitoring tech as part of Project LEO
lead: Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) has installed 81 low-voltage monitors in another step for Project Local Energy Oxfordshire (Project LEO).
author: Molly Lempriere
